poem:
Title: Lament for Alfie Steele 

A babe's cry from Droitwich, drowned in bureaucracy,
While Apate duped the force of the watch,
And Misos wed to brutality birthed mischief,
Sixty times missed, a sorrow's pearl; it was enough.
Alfie, the nightingale crushed beneath unheeding boots,
Fair humanity suffocated by 'safe and well' suits,
Recorded echoes stirring, mute against heaven's tribunal.
God's unanswered, seeking justice for His small mortal.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
